Another large-scale combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine last night. The main target was Poltava Oblast, where Kremenchuk, Hlobyne, and Lubny were all hit.
Kremenchuk bore the brunt of the attack, with all missiles flying there. 8-10 Kh-101 cruise missiles impacted the oil refinery. Additionally, 3 Iskander-M ballistic missiles were launched, but Ukraine appears to have shifted a patriot system to the area due to the repeated attacks there, and reports suggest that 1 Iskander may have been intercepted. 
In addition to the missiles. At least 20 Geran drones attacked the city before the missiles hit, with most of them impacting the refinery. 
Lubny, on the otherhand, was targeted with the majority of the Gerans in the region. At least 36 drones attacked it, with approximately 30 impacting. One of the targets here was the Lubenskoe natural gas compressor station.
Additionally, the Plishyvets Gas Well was targeted by a number of Gerans.

Additionally, 3 Iskander-M ballistic missiles were launched, but Ukraine appears to have shifted a patriot system to the area due to the repeated attacks there, and reports suggest that 1 Iskander may have been intercepted. 
In addition to the missiles. At least 20 Geran drones attacked the city before the missiles hit, with most of them impacting the refinery. 
Lubny, on the otherhand, was targeted with the majority of the Gerans in the region. At least 36 drones attacked it, with approximately 30 impacting. One of the targets here was the Lubenskoe natural gas compressor station.
Additionally, the Plishyvets Gas Well was targeted by a number of Gerans.

Another large-scale combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine last night. The main target was Poltava Oblast, where Kremenchuk, Hlobyne, and Lubny were all hit.  Kremenchuk bore the brunt of the attack, with all missiles flying there.‚Ä¶
NASA FIRMS data shows massive fires burning at the Kremenchuk Oil Refinery.
NASA FIRMS data shows massive fires burning at the Kremenchuk Oil Refinery.
Fires can also be seen burning at the Lubenskoe natural gas compressor station (media 1) and the Plishyvets Gas Well (media 2).
Fires can also be seen burning at the Lubenskoe natural gas compressor station (media 1) and the Plishyvets Gas Well (media 2).

Last night, 2 Russian Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from Taganrog, Rostov Oblast, impacted Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast. A reconnaissance drone was operating at the time of the strikes. 
Later on, at least 10 Geran-2 drone strikes targeted the city and the surrounding areas, and in the early morning at around 6:15am, 4 MLRS strikes targeted the vicinity of the city. 
Videos are all from the Iskander strikes.

Last night, 2 Russian Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from Taganrog, Rostov Oblast, impacted Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast. A reconnaissance drone was operating at the time of the strikes. 
Later on, at least 10 Geran-2 drone strikes targeted the city and the surrounding areas, and in the early morning at around 6:15am, 4 MLRS strikes targeted the vicinity of the city. 
Videos are all from the Iskander strikes.

Last night, 2 Russian Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from Taganrog, Rostov Oblast, impacted Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast. A reconnaissance drone was operating at the time of the strikes.   Later on, at least 10 Geran-2 drone strikes targeted the city‚Ä¶

The target of the 2 Iskander-M strikes on Slovyansk was a temporary deployment point used by Azov (confirmed by locals). This is why it took over 12 hours for official photos to be released, compared to the usual 1-4 hours.
Coordinates: 48.8547272, 37.5837133

Coordinates: 48.8547272, 37.5837133

Another large-scale combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine last night. The main target was Poltava Oblast, where Kremenchuk, Hlobyne, and Lubny were all hit.  Kremenchuk bore the brunt of the attack, with all missiles flying there.‚Ä¶
Massive fires continue to burn uncontained at the Kremenchuk Oil Refinery in Poltava Oblast.

Satellite imagery shows that Ukrainian drones (likely FPV drones launched from USVs) attacked a "Kasta-2E2" radar station near the village of Khutorok, Crimea. Afterwards, a fire was recorded and a net was placed over the destroyed station, obscuring it from view. 
Coordinates: 45.258430, 33.152500
Credit: 
https://t.me/kiber_boroshno/11935

This morning, ~4 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked the town of Vasylkivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. The target was the secondary school, where a large fire is now burning. 
Coordinates: 48.217675, 36.011639

This morning, ~4 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked the town of Vasylkivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. The target was the secondary school, where a large fire is now burning. 
Coordinates: 48.217675, 36.011639

In the Borova direction, Russian forces continued to advance, making further progress on the tactical heights.
Russian forces advanced in two areas. Most of the progress was made in the south, where Russian forces pushed outwards from the newly captured village of Zelenyi Hai. They advanced over the gulley and secured a forested area, as well as the northern ends of three parallel treelines. They were also able to advance west from Zelenyi Hai, capturing positions in the treeline on the northern edge of that same gulley.
In the north, Russian forces began securing the northern flank of their wedge that runs to the north of Borivska Andriivka. They were able to improve their positions in the treelines here. 
+ ~8.16km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Ukrainian MLRS (not HIMARS) attacked Horlivka, Donetsk Oblast a few minutes ago. Russian S-300/400 air defence missiles from Makiivka engaged the rockets. The rockets were launched from the southwestern outskirts of Druzhkivka.

Ukrainian MLRS (not HIMARS) attacked Horlivka, Donetsk Oblast a few minutes ago. Russian S-300/400 air defence missiles from Makiivka engaged the rockets. The rockets were launched from the southwestern outskirts of Druzhkivka.
It seems that the MLRS hit something near Avdiivka.

On the northeastern flank of Siversk, Russian forces have captured most, if not all of the rest of the village of Serebryanka.
Russian forces advanced from their positions in the centre of the settlement, pushing towards the western outskirts. They were able to establish control over numerous positions in the ruined residential area, eventually forcing a Ukrainian withdrawal to the nearby tactical heights.
It's reported that the westernmost houses remain in the grey zone, and that the Russians haven't consolidated their positions, however flags were raised there earlier. 
+ ~1.87km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Drone Footage Shows Rare Strikes on Russian Fuel Train in Zaporozhzhie
Newly released footage from the southern Zaporozhzhie region provides a stark and detailed look at the relentless targeting of logistics. The video, captured by Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles, shows a series of strikes on a Russian military train, specifically designed to transport vital fuel to the front lines. The recording underscores the tactical reality: Ukrainian drones can penetrate deep in the rear, threatening Russia‚Äôs military supply chains...

Tensions Simmer on Bryansk Border: Another Ukrainian Sabotage Group Neutralized
Ukrainian sabotage group was discovered and eliminated in the Bryansk region, 40 kilometers from the state border. Three were killed, three surrendered, including the commander. They planned to blow up a major railway junction and take a series of photos for new media victories. The group of Special Operation Forces were detected in the Komarichi district of the Bryansk region....

U.S. Officials Admit Failure In Stopping Arms Shipments To Yemen‚Äôs Houthis
The Houthis (Ansar Allah) are still arming themselves with help from Iran and efforts by the United States and its allies to cut the group‚Äôs supply lines have been ineffective, Al-Arabiya reported on August 19, citing U.S. officials.
Recent weeks saw forces loyal to the internationally-recognized Yemeni government, which is allied to the U.S., seizing two weapons shipments en-route to the Houthis, one from Iran loaded with advanced anti-aircraft and anti-ship missiles, and another from China containing advanced drones...

1,000 To 19 Somber Exchange: Unspoken Language of War‚Äôs Toll
In the grim arithmetic of modern conflict, few events speak more plainly than the exchange of the fallen. On August 19th, Russia and Ukraine conducted another such transfer of bodies, a stark procedure that lays bare the brutal realities of the war‚Äôs human cost. The terms of the exchange were profoundly asymmetrical: Ukraine received the bodies of one thousand of its soldiers, while Russia recovered nineteen...

Battle for Pokrovsk‚Äôs Northern Flank: Ukrainian Counterattacks Stall
Despite renewed diplomatic efforts to initiate a peace process, the intensity of combat on the Ukrainian fronts remains undiminished. The Pokrovsk urban agglomeration is still one of the most fiercely contested battlefields. The nature of the fighting, characterized by Russian tactics employing small assault groups in a strategy of ‚Äútotal infiltration‚Äù deep into Ukrainian defensive positions, has made it difficult to delineate clear front lines or zones of control. This ambiguity is actively exploited by Kyiv‚Äôs propaganda units, which frequently announce media victories that often bear little resemblance to the situation on the ground. In reality, the position of the Ukrainian army in this sector remains increasingly precarious...
